io.hekate.network

Interface NetworkServer

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    NettyServer

    public interface NetworkServer
    Standalone TCP server.

    Overview

    This interface represents a standalone TCP server.

    Configuration

    Configuration of the standalone TCP server is represented by NetworkServerFactoryBase class. Please see its javadoc for information about available configuration options.

    Starting and stopping

    Server can be started by calling start(InetSocketAddress, NetworkServerCallback) method and providing an optional callback that will be notified upon lifecycle events. This method is asynchronous and returns a future object that can be used to get operation results.

    It is possible to start server that will bind to a network interface but will not automatically accept connections from NetworkClients. This can be achieved by setting NetworkServerFactoryBase.setAutoAccept(boolean) option to false. In this case all clients that are trying to connect will be blocked unless startAccepting() method is called.

    Server can be stopped by calling stop() method. This method is also asynchronous and returns a future object that can be used to get operation results.

    Instantiation

    Instances of this interface can be obtained via NetworkServerFactoryBase.createServer() method.

    Server failover

    Whenever an error occurs, server notifies NetworkServerCallback.onFailure(NetworkServer, NetworkServerFailure) callback. Implementation of this method can control which actions should be performed in this case by analyzing NetworkServerFailure and returning a NetworkServerFailure.Resolution instance. Based on this information server can decide on whether to try the same address, rebind to another address or stop.

    • Method Detail

      • address

        InetSocketAddress address()
        Returns bind address or null if server is not started.
        Returns:
        Server address or null if server is not started.

      • state

        NetworkServer.State state()
        Returns the lifecycle state of this server.
        Returns:
        Lifecycle state.

      • start

        NetworkServerFuture start(InetSocketAddress bindAddress)
                   throws IllegalStateException
        Asynchronously starts this server and binds it to the specified address.
        Parameters:
        bindAddress - Bind address (use InetSocketAddress.InetSocketAddress(int) if server must accept connections on all network interfaces). If port value of the specified address is 0 then port will be auto-assigned by the operating system.
        Returns:
        Future object that can be used to obtain result of this operation.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown if server is not in STOPPED state.

      • start

        NetworkServerFuture start(InetSocketAddress bindAddress,
                          NetworkServerCallback callback)
        Asynchronously starts this server and binds it to the specified address.
        Parameters:
        bindAddress - Bind address (use InetSocketAddress.InetSocketAddress(int) if server must accept connections on all network interfaces). If port value of the specified address is 0 then port will be auto-assigned by the operating system.
        callback - Optional callback for listening server lifecycle events and performing errors failover.
        Returns:
        Future object that can be used to obtain result of this operation.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - Thrown if server is not in STOPPED state.

      • startAccepting

        void startAccepting()
        Starts accepting connection from clients.

        This method must be called only if NetworkServerFactoryBase.setAutoAccept(boolean) is set to false. If it is set to true then server will accept connections automatically once it is started.

      • stop

        NetworkServerFuture stop()
        Asynchronously stops this server and closes all active client connections.

        This method does nothing if server is already in STOPPED or STOPPING state.

        Returns:
        Future object that can be used to obtain result of this operation.

      • addHandler

        void addHandler(NetworkServerHandlerConfig<?> handler)
        Registers the specified handler to this server.

        Handlers can be registered at any time and do not depend on whether server is stopped or is running.

        Parameters:
        handler - Handler.

      • removeHandler

        List<NetworkEndpoint<?>> removeHandler(String protocol)
        Unregisters NetworkServerHandler with the specified protocol identifier and returns a list of NetworkEndpoints that were connected at the time of this operation.

        All new client connections for the specified protocol will be rejected after this operation completes.

        This method does nothing if there is no such server handler with the specified protocol identifier. In such case an empty list will be returned.

        Parameters:
        protocol - Protocol identifier (see NetworkServerHandlerConfig.setProtocol(String)).
        Returns:
        List of connected clients or an empty list if there is no such handler or no connected clients.

      • clients

        List<NetworkEndpoint<?>> clients(String protocol)
        Returns the list of network endpoints that are currently connected to this server with the specified protocol.
        Parameters:
        protocol - Protocol (see NetworkServerHandlerConfig.setProtocol(String)).
        Returns:
        List of network endpoints or an empty list if there are now connected endpoints.
